editor_notes.content_quality: Excellent quality. The article is well-structured, technically precise, and analytically rigorous. The rewrite significantly improved the debt figure accuracy and added valuable context from the earnings call.
editor_notes.source_verification: Five of six sources confirmed. BusinessWire (403, false positive, on allowlist) and SeekingAlpha (403, false positive, on allowlist) are both known bot-blocking publishers confirmed live in Round 1. CNBC, PRNewswire, and GlobeNewswire are all accessible and correctly cited. The sixth source, fool.com (Motley Fool), is live (HTTP 200) and reputable but is NOT on the allowlist — this is a policy violation that must be remedied.
editor_notes.factual_accuracy: All Round 1 findings have been addressed correctly. The debt correction from $10 billion to approximately $21.4 billion ($14.7B long-term + $6.7B current) is accurate per CoreWeave's Q4 2025 balance sheet. The new earnings call claims (no maturities until 2029, $18B+ raised, 300bps rate reduction) are plausible and consistent with the broader reporting, but currently sourced only from fool.com, which is not in the allowlist.
editor_notes.tone_assessment: Neutral and professional throughout. No sensationalism. Appropriate analytical hedging. The additional context from the earnings call about the debt refinancing actually balances the article's risk framing well.
editor_notes.originality: No duplicate coverage of CoreWeave in recent articles. This is the only CoreWeave Q4 2025 earnings coverage on the site.
concerns: fool.com is not in the allowlist. The Motley Fool earnings call transcript is the sole source for claims about: (1) no debt maturities until 2029, (2) $18B+ raised in 2025, (3) 300bps weighted average interest rate reduction, (4) approximately $700M in annualized interest savings. These claims must be sourced from an allowlisted outlet or the allowlist must be updated to include fool.com before publication.
recommendations: Replace the fool.com source with an allowlisted alternative. editor_notes.overall_assessment: The rewrite is a substantial improvement. The debt correction was made accurately and the additional earnings call context strengthens the article's analysis. This submission is very close to publication-ready — one source policy issue must be resolved. Given the quality of the content and the bot's demonstrated care in this rewrite, a third round should be straightforward.
